text: tell me boi, why you don't like undertale ? It's not to shitstorm you btw, i'm just genuinely curious
author: Louis Claudel

text: @Louis Claudel I'm not the original commenter, but for me personally, the absolute tyranny of the fandom back when the game was most popular and the horror stories I heard of how they treated people was enough to turn me away from the game completely. It's a shame, the game looks really good, and the music is great, but I have negative desire to play it.
author: DScribbleF

text:
@DScribbleF aaah yes i see. I totally understand. As you can see from my avatar i'm an "undertale-fag", lol.... Even tho i never really liked the community of the game. As you said, lots of cringy weird kids doing weird stuff. And yeah, overall the fanbase is pretty atrocious. This is one of the reason why i personnaly don't identify myself as "part" of that fanbase, even tho I adore the game. 


I can understand your feelings, when people overhype something it always become annoying after a certain time. 
But the most important thing in the end is the "game". Not the fans, not the community, just the "game" itself. Which is still one hell of an experience !


And as you said, you seem to feel like the game and the musics are great (and they really are haha), but what stops you is the opinion you have from it because of the community.... So if i can "reassure" you in any way (not sure this is the correct word for that lol), i'll just say that, don't worry, the game is not what the fans make it look like. It's  hard to articulate, but what  i simply mean, is that, if you ever feel like playing it one day, you'll be happy to notice that it doesn't affiliate with all the cringy weird stuff you saw from the fans, it's just..... a very good game. And that's it x) cringy fan or not. hope one day, you can give it shot and appreciate its worth for what it is o/ peace
author: Louis Claudel

text: @Louis Claudel I wish more people like you were in any kind of fandoms. Bless your soul.

author: Jared Silvestri

text: If you're not stuck at work, you can play the start of what seems to be the sequel to Undertale, for free. As a big fan of Undertale, this is exciting! Toby Fox dropped the link in the description. As with Undertale, I do not recommend reading anything on it until you play it yourself. This track instantly reminds me of something Yoko Shimomura would compose (I especially get Radiant Historia vibes).
